div.l: He wende haue cropen̄ bi his felau Iohn
And bi the mylner͗e he crepis doun̄ anon̄
And caught him bi the necke ⁊and soft he spake
He seid thou swyneshede a wake
For cristis soule ⁊and here a noble game
For by that lord that called is seint Iame
As I haue thries in this short night
Swyued the mylners dought̉er bolt upriȝt
Whils þou hast as a coward leyn̄ agast
Ye fals harlot qᵈuod þe mylner hast
A fals traitour fals clerk coth he
Thou shalt be dede by goddis dignite
Who durst be so bold to disparage
My doughter / þᵗat is comen̄ of such linage
And bi the throte bolle he caught aleyn̄
And he hent him despitously ageyne
And on the nose he smote hym̄ wᵗith hꝭis fest
Doun ranne the blody streme on his brest
And in the floor͗e wᵗith nose ⁊and mouth to broke
Thei walown̄ fast as piggis done in poke
And up̄pe thei gone ⁊and doun̄ ageyn̄ anone
Til þat the mylner stumblid on̄ a stone
And doun̄ he fille bakward on his wife
That wist no thing of this nyce strife
For she was fallen̄ a slepe a litle wight
With Iohn the clerc þat wakid al þe night
And wᵗith the falle out of hir slepe she breid
Helpe holi cros of bromeholme she seid
In manus tuas lord to thee I calle
A wake Simond the fende is on us fall
Myn̄ hert is brook help̄ I nam̄ but dede
Þ̉er lithe upon̄ my wombe ⁊and eke on̄ myn̄ hede
Helpe Symkin for the fals clerkis fight
Þis Iohn stert up̄pe as fast as eủer he might
And graspid bi the wallis too and froo
To finde a staffe and she stirt up̄pe also
And knew the Estirs bette than did þis Ion
And by the walle a staffe she toke anon
